hsrt.mec.controldeveloper.io

Class TextFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • hsrt.mec.controldeveloper.io.TextFile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IOType

    public class TextFile
extends Object
implements IOType
    TextFile writes strings into a plain text file. After every string a carriage return is written. This enables to read every single row out of the file.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TextFile(File f, boolean append)
      Creates a new TextFile object based on a given File object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextFile

        public TextFile(File f,
        boolean append)
        Creates a new TextFile object based on a given File object. A file can be created in the actual working directory using:

        new File( System.getProperty("user.dir") + "\\<filename>.<suffix>" );
        Parameters:
        f - The given file.
        append - true, if data shall be appended to the given file; false, if a potentially existing file shall be overwritten.
        See Also:
        File

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public boolean read(Vector<String> data)
        Reads data from the specified file. The data is provided by the Vector object given as an input parameter.
        Specified by:
        read in interface IOType
        Parameters:
        data - The vector that contains the input data in a string format.
        Returns:
        false, in case of an error; true, otherwise. In case of an error information about the error can be accessed using class Status.
        See Also:
        Status

      • write

        public boolean write(Vector<String> data)
        Writes data to the specified file.
        Specified by:
        write in interface IOType
        Parameters:
        data - The vector that contains the output data in a string format.
        Returns:
        false, in case of an error; true, otherwise. In case of an error information about the error can be accessed using class Status.
        See Also:
        Status

      • close

        public boolean close()
        Closes the specified file. Closing a previously closed file has no effect. In case of an error information about the error can be accessed using class Status.
        Specified by:
        close in interface IOType
        Returns:
        false, in case of an error; true, otherwise.
        See Also:
        Status

        public static void main(String[] s)
